comments.body: Why is `local_file` required here? Are `local_file` and `remote_file` not mutually exclusive?

No, remote_file and local_file are not mutually exclusive. Basically when we are copying files, if we want the destination file name to be same as source file name then we can provide just the remote_file. If we want the destination file name to be different, we can give local_file. So this is optional but not mutually exclusive.
The original code (for copying files using scp server on the switch) also has the same logic.
Will this line throw an error when `file_pull` is `True` but `local_file` is not set in the playbook?
No, because we are passing ```local``` which can be the name of ```local_file``` but if it is not in the playbook, it uses ```remote_file```

comments.body:
Port of `I(remote_scp_server)` or ...?
Wonder if this should have an aliases `remote_scp_port`

No, the connect_ssh_port is the ssh port of the network device. This is completely different from remote_scp information. The latter is a different machine which just runs the scp server. We do not need the scp port for that as of now because the ```copy scp ...``` command which is used on the device to pull the file from the remote scp server does not take any port information.
